pop_quiz_llm1.question: An AI trained on massive amounts of text can understand what words mean and use that understanding to answer questions, just like a human.

true.text: Not quite. While AI can predict words and patterns very well, it doesn't actually understand meaning like humans do.

false.text: Correct! AI doesn't truly understand meaning - it's actually very good at recognizing patterns in text and predicting what words should come next.

pop_quiz_llm2.question: What best describes the role of training data when building an AI?

options.text: A. It helps the AI memorize exact sentences
B. It teaches the AI emotional understanding
C. It feeds the AI examples so it can learn word patterns
D. It teaches the AI to translate spoken language into sound

a.text: Not quite. AI doesn't just memorize sentences - it learns patterns from them.

b.text: No, AI doesn't actually develop emotional understanding from training data.

c.text: Correct! Training data helps the AI learn patterns in how words and phrases are used together.

d.text: No, text training data isn't about sound translation.
